title: How to Change Your Email Address on LinkedIn

steps.title: Open the LinkedIn app.
steps.content: Open the LinkedIn app. Its icon resembles the white letters "in" on a blue background. If you aren't logged into LinkedIn, tap Sign In , enter your email address and password, and tap Sign In .

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's the person-shaped icon in the bottom right corner of the screen (iPhone) or the right side of the tool bar at the top of the screen (Android).

steps.title: Tap ⚙️.
steps.content: Tap ⚙️ . It's in the top right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Email addresses.
steps.content: Tap Email addresses . This option is at the top of the "Account" screen.

steps.title: Tap Add email address.
steps.content: Tap Add email address . It's the blue button at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the email address field, then type in an email address.
steps.content: Tap the email address field, then type in an email address. The "Email address" field is near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the password field, then type in your LinkedIn password.
steps.content: Tap the password field, then type in your LinkedIn password. It should be the same password you use to log into LinkedIn.

steps.title: Tap Submit, then tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Submit , then tap Done . LinkedIn will send a confirmation email to your provided email address.

steps.title: Verify your email address.
steps.content: Verify your email address. To do so: Open your email inbox. Tap the email from LinkedIn Security. The subject will read "Confirm your email address." If you do not see the email, check the spam folder. Tap the " this " link in the email's body.

steps.title: Re-open the LinkedIn app.
steps.content: Re-open the LinkedIn app. It will open to the page you left it on.

steps.title: Tap Make primary.
steps.content: Tap Make primary . This link is below the new email address you just added.

steps.title: Type in your LinkedIn password.
steps.content: Type in your LinkedIn password.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . Your new email address is now your primary email address. You'll enter this email when signing into LinkedIn from now on.

steps.title: Open the LinkedIn webpage.
steps.content: Open the LinkedIn webpage . If you're already logged into LinkedIn, doing so will open your Home page. If you aren't logged in, enter your email address and password at the top of the page and click Sign In .

steps.title: Click Me.
steps.content: Click Me . It's the person-shaped icon in the top right corner of the Home screen.

steps.title: Click Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & Privacy . You'll see this option directly under the "Account" heading in the drop-down menu here.

steps.title: Click Email addresses.
steps.content: Click Email addresses . It's at the top of the "Account" section of this page, directly under the "Basics" heading.

steps.title: Click Add email address.
steps.content: Click Add email address . This option is toward the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Type in an email address.
steps.content: Type in an email address.

steps.title: Click Send Verification.
steps.content: Click Send Verification . Doing so will prompt you to enter your LinkedIn password.

steps.title: Type in your LinkedIn password.
steps.content: Type in your LinkedIn password. This must be the password you use to log into LinkedIn.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . Doing so will prompt LinkedIn to send a verification email to the address you just entered.

steps.title: Open your email account.
steps.content: Open your email account. It should be the same email address you just added to LinkedIn.

steps.title: Click the email from "LinkedIn Security".
steps.content: Click the email from "LinkedIn Security". The subject will say "Confirm your email address." If you don't see the email from LinkedIn, check your email inbox's spam folder.

steps.title: Click the "this" link.
steps.content: Click the " this " link. It's in the email's body text. Doing so will add this email account to your LinkedIn profile, though your other email address will still be your primary account. Alternatively, you can copy and paste the blue link here into your browser's URL bar.

steps.title: Return to the "Email addresses" page.
steps.content: Return to the "Email addresses" page. To do so, you'll click the Me tab in the top right corner of the Home screen, click Settings & Privacy , and click Email addresses near the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Make Primary next to your email address.
steps.content: Click Make Primary next to your email address. This should be the email address you wish to set as your primary LinkedIn address.

steps.title: Type in your LinkedIn password.
steps.content: Type in your LinkedIn password.

steps.title: Click Make Primary.
steps.content: Click Make Primary . As long as your password is correct, your selected email is now your LinkedIn account's primary email address. You'll use it to log into LinkedIn in addition to having it as your primary point of contact for other LinkedIn users.

steps.title: Open the LinkedIn webpage.
steps.content: Open the LinkedIn webpage . You should see a "New Account" creation section in the middle of the page and a login section at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Forgot Password?.
steps.content: Click Forgot Password? . It's below the "Password" field at the top of the page.

steps.title: Type in your email address or phone number.
steps.content: Type in your email address or phone number. These credentials must be registered with your LinkedIn account.

steps.title: Click Submit.
steps.content: Click Submit . Doing so will send a verification message to the email account associated with your provided credentials. You have two options from this point: If you have access to the email address in question, open it. From there, click on the email entitled "[Name], here's a link to reset your password", click the link in the email's body, and type in a new password. If you don't have access to the email address, proceed to the next step.

steps.title: Click I don't have access to my email.
steps.content: Click I don't have access to my email .

steps.title: Type in a new email address twice.
steps.content: Type in a new email address twice. You'll do so in the two fields on this page.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . It's at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Select your current country.
steps.content: Select your current country. To do so, click the box under "Country" and then click on your current country's name.

steps.title: Click an ID type.
steps.content: Click an ID type. You will have at most three options: Passport Identity Card Driver License

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue .

steps.title: Upload pictures of your document.
steps.content: Upload pictures of your document. This process will vary depending on the identification document you choose (e.g., passport), but you'll need to have pictures of the necessary information already on your computer. For example, if you're using your driver's license, you'll need a clear picture of both the front and back of your license. To upload the documents, you'll click the Upload button on this page, then select your picture from its location on your computer and click OK .

steps.title: Allow your documents to be analyzed.
steps.content: Allow your documents to be analyzed. Do not close your browser at this time. Once your documents are approved, you will see the following message: ”Success! Thank you for completing the verification process. We successfully received your documents. A member of our Trust and Safety team will review your information and get back to you soon.”

steps.title: Wait for a member of LinkedIn’s Trust and Safety team to contact you.
steps.content: Wait for a member of LinkedIn’s Trust and Safety team to contact you. You should have access to your account within 5 business days as long as all of your identification information checks out. [2] X Research source
